creator: loisel.jerome@gmail.com
text:
Hi,

When using JMeter 3.2 as dependency, it completely breaks on code on runtime with the following error:
java.lang.VerifyError: class org.apache.jorphan.logging.Slf4jLogkitLogger overrides final method info.(Ljava/lang/String;)V

We also use slf4j 1.7.25 in our code. When switching back to JMeter 3.1 maven dependencies, everything works fine.

Is there something we can do to avoid loading this logger class? It makes the 3.2 dependencies unusable.

creator: loisel.jerome@gmail.com
text: We only use slf4j-api in our code as a dependency.
Found the issue: apparently, it's conflicting with logkit-2.0 which declares the logger class org.apache.log.Logger, which is also declared in jorphan 2.0 JAR.
creator: loisel.jerome@gmail.com
support@ubikloadpack.com
text:
(In reply to Jerome from comment #2)
> Found the issue: apparently, it's conflicting with logkit-2.0 which declares
> the logger class org.apache.log.Logger, which is also declared in jorphan
> 2.0 JAR.

But logkit is no more a dependency of JMeter
I'm currently investigating where it does come from.
creator: loisel.jerome@gmail.com
loisel.jerome@gmail.com
text: Okay got it, we also have a dependency on an older JMeter plugin which depends on JMeter 2.13, which includes Logkit as dependency.
